SENT.plain: A 47-year-old man had an embolic stroke
Transesophageal echocardiography showed biatrial, elongated, mobile masses that appeared interconnected via a patent foramen ovale
Echocardiography did not distinguish between an interatrial clot in transit and an atypical biatrial myxoma
Surgical resection and subsequent histopathologic examination identified the mass as a biatrial myxoma
This case identifies a limitation of echocardiography in the diagnosis of cardiac myxoma
